At the same time, she raises horses, sheep, and bulls, which she considers her capital in trading animals.  Yuli recognizes that these activities require months to see profits and it is very necessary to have additional income to maintain her daughter. That's why she also takes on employment as a secretary in the municipal government of her locality.

Yuli's dream is to have great extensions of cultivable land and also, to have a larger quantity of livestock which she intends to expand each time she earns profits.

This is Yuli's 2nd loan through MFP. While a borrower, she has demonstrated her responsibility, always paying punctually through her communal bank, earning the confidence of the other members. She believes that their confidence in her is most important in order to gain her objectives.

With this loan, she will invest in buying sacks of organic manure and sheep.

loans.use: buy sacks of manure and sheep.

loans.name: Celso David

texts.es:
Celso David tiene 31 años, es soltero vive con la madre y con no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Celso se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es casarse e irse de viaje.

Le gusta ver películas y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Celso David, 31, is single, has no children and lives with his mother.  He lives in the Ventanas Cantón in Provincia de Los Ríos.   

This communal bank is called UNIDOS VENCEREMOS and is located in Recinto La América in Ventanas Cantón.  Our bank focuses on short-term farming that includes planing corn, rice, and gandul beans.  Celso has worked as a farmer cultivating corn and rice for a long time.  Each month he makes purchases in Ventana and sells his products at the market there.  

He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers knowing that the support of this loan will help him buy what he needs.  He deals with challenges like pests, crop diseases, and variable weather. Celso dreams of getting married and going on a trip.  He likes movies and sports.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: José Maria tiene 60 años, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo. Se dedica a la comercialización de venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 20 años pues fue con recursos propios que empezó este medio de vida. Esta actividad es su principal fuente ingreso por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. José desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y aumentar el número de ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez un crédito para la compra de tratamientos, ropa en general, cosmético y calzado. El es una persona tranquila y bastante emprendedora.
texts.en:
José Maria is 60 years old, married, and lives together with his wife and son.  His business is selling general merchandise and he has been in the business for more than 20 years.  He started out with his own resources.

This business is José's main source of income so he tries to keep it running in the best way possible.  José would like to acquire more products so that he can expand his business and increase his number of sales.  For this reason, he is requesting his first loan to buy treatments, clothes, cosmetics and footwear.  He is a calm and entrepreneurial person.

loans.use: to buy treatments, clothes, cosmetics and footwear

loans.name: Santos Simion

texts.es:
Santos, habita en la comunidad el Ocotolillo, ubicada en Yali, municipio de Jinotega, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, el es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de café. Inicio a cultivar café, en la parcela de su papa, a la edad de 15 años de edad. Cuando recibió una herencia de su padre, se independizo el ya tenia 22 años de edad, se caso, sus hijos estudian en una escuela ubicada en la comunidad. A pesar de que el solo estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria, por dedicarse a trabajar, el quiere un mejor futuro para sus hijos. El señor Santos también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, vende plátanos que son otros ingresos que el posee.    
Solicito el préstamo para sembrar café, comprar abono, insumos, pago de mano de obra. Con esta inversión espera darle un mejor mantenimiento a su cultivo, sacar una cosecha de buena calidad y buen rendimiento. El esta enfocado en seguir mejorando su siembra de café, desea poder comprar una manzana mas de tierra para cultivar  café, mejorar su casa. Su meta próxima es sembrar 2 manzanas de frijoles, una manzana de maíz, y cultivar café.
texts.en:
Santos lives in Ocotolillo community, in Yali, in Jinotega.  He is 37 years old, has two children and works as a coffee farmer.

Santos started growing coffee on a plot of land belonging to his dad at the age of 15.  When he was 22 years old, Santos received his inheritance from his father and started working independently.  He also got married.   Santos' children are attending school in their community.  In spite of the fact that he only studied up to the fourth year of elementary school because he started working, Santos would like a better future for his children.  He also grows basic grains such as corn and beans, and sells bananas which makes him an extra income.

Santos requested this loan to help him grow his coffee.  He will buy fertilizer and supplies, and pay laborers.  With this investment, he hopes to better maintain his coffee crop, obtain a good-quality harvest and a good yield.  He is focused on continuing to improve his coffee growing and would like to buy an additional 'manzana' (approximately 1.68 acres) of land on which to grow coffee.  He would also like to improve his home.  His next goal is to sow two 'manzanas' of land with beans, one with corn and grow coffee.

loans.use: to grow coffee.  He will buy fertilizers and supplies, and pay laborers

loans.name: Damaris Esther

texts.es:
Damaris, es soltera, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de bisutería, este negocio lo inicio hace un año, junto a su madre, lograron comenzar un nuevo negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, hilo, piedras, broches de diferentes estilos, con esta inversión su negocio estará más fuerte, y con estos materiales podrá construir nuevos estilos de accesorios como collares, aretes, pulseras.
 Su objetivo es tener un negocio bien establecido, con mayores ingresos, que puedan cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Damaris is single and doesn't have any children.  Her business is making and selling costume jewelry.  She set up her business one year ago, together with her mother.  They managed to start a new business.

Damaris is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business: thread, stones and different styles of clasp.  This investment will strengthen her business and, with these materials, she will be able to make new styles of accessories such as necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

Damaris' goal is to have a well-established business which makes more money so that she can cover all her needs.

loans.use: to buy thread, stones and different styles of clasp for making necklaces and bracelets

loans.name: Andrea Clemencia

texts.es:
Andrea Clemencia tiene 40 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Andrea se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es salir de viaje y comprar tierras.

Le gusta hacer deporte y ver television.
texts.en:
Andrea Clemencia is 40 years old, married and lives with her husband and their children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

Her communal bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (United We Will Overcome).  The bank is located in Recinto La América, which is in Ventanas Canton.  The communal bank is dedicated to short cycle farm work like growing corn, rice and gandul beans.

Andrea makes her living in agriculture, in particular planting corn and rice, which she was been doing for a long time.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the Ventanas market as well.

Andrea is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers.  The loan will help her financially so she will be able to provide for her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, crop disease and variations in the weather.  Her dreams are to go on a trip and to purchase land. 

Andrea likes to do sports and watch television.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Damarys Eugenia

texts.es:
Damarys Eugenia tiene 35 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Damarys se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es salir adelante y progresar en la produccion.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Damarys Eugenia is 35 years old, married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in El Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

This village bank is called UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, and is located at the La América Area in Cantón  Ventanas.   This village bank works in agriculture growing short-cycle corn, rice and large beans.

Damarys works in agriculture and has specifically been growing corn and rice for a long time.  She makes her purchases each month in Ventanas and also sells at the fair there.

She has applied for the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and manure.  With the economic help of the loan she will be able to fulfill her needs, confront challenges like plagues and disease in the crops and the climate change.  Her dream is to get ahead and see progress in the production.

She likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Faiane

texts.en:
Faiane is 58 years old and married with 10 children. Faiane owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Faiane needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faiane joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faiane's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Vaitupua

texts.en:
Vaitupua is 36 years old and married with six children. Vaitupua owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Vaitupua needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Vaitupua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Vaitupua's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Nancy Pilar

texts.es:
Nancy Pilar tiene 33 años, es soltera vive con la madre, tiene una hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

nancy se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es salir adelante.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Nancy Pilar is 33 years old, single, and lives with her mother.  She has one daughter.  They live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (Together We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Nancy grows crops, especially corn and rice.  She has been doing this for a long time.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the market in the same town.

Nancy is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to get ahead.

Nancy enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Carlos Bismark

texts.es: Carlos Bismark tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de gaseosas, jugos, agua y gaseosas. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio con esfuerzo propio y con mucho sacrificio ha sacado adelante su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de su actividad pues le gusta mucho ofrecer estos productos a sus clientes. Este financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de agua sellada, jugos, gaseosas, entre otros. Sueña con ampliar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en:
Carlos Bismark is 30 years old.  His business is selling soda, juice and water.  He has been in this business for more than five years.  Carlos started out through his own efforts and, with a lot of sacrifice, he has managed to get ahead in his business.  Carlos is a very hard-working person who enjoys his work as he really likes selling these products to his customers.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy water, juice, soda, etc.  He dreams of further expanding his business every day.

loans.use: to buy water, juice, soda, etc.

loans.name: Matalau

texts.en:
Matalau is 36 years old and married with three children. Matalau owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Matalau needs a loan of WST $1,000 to rent land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Matalau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Matalau's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Fuamai

texts.en:
Fuamai is 32 years old and she is a single female with no child. Fuamai owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Fuamai needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase farming equipments such as knives, spade and weed killer.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Fuamai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuamai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipments such as knives, spade and weed killer

loans.name: Saira Eveling

texts.es:
Saira Eveñing tiene 21 años, es casada vive con el esposo no tienen hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Saira se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es tener casa y comprar una finca para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Saira Eveling is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband.  They do not have any children.  They live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (United We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of the bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Saira grows crops, especially corn and rice.  She has been doing this for a long time.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the market in the same town.

Saira is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home and to buy a farm so that she can continue growing her crops.

Saira enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is 30 years old and married with five children. Peka owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Peka needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase knives, spades, wheel-barrow and sacks of fertilizers to expand and improve her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Peka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Peka's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase knives, spades, wheel-barrow and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Olioli

texts.en:
Olioli is 30 years old and married with five children. Olioli owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Olioli needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase sacks fertilizers and gromozones to improve the standard of her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Olioli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Olioli's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones to improve her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 38 years old and married with six children. Rosalina owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Rosalina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase knives, spades, wheel-barrow, sacks of fertilizers and gromozones to improve the standard of her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Rosalina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Rosalina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase  knives, spades, wheel-barrow, sacks of fertilizers and gromozones to improve her business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes, vive en Morelia Municipio de Coapilla, ella es casada con el señor  Galileo, con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.
    Ella es la  tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con Fundación Realidad y esta vez es para invertirlo en a compra de mercancía para surtir subtienda de abarrotes, en donde comenta que  a pesar que lleva  un año con ello le va bien ya que  ve que le está dando u buen resultado.
    En ello se inspiro por si sola ya que es un negocio bueno que le  dejara un buen ingresos en su hogar, con ello podrá seguir trabajando con le préstamo que ha estado solicitando.
    Su más grande seo es que con esta actividad y el préstamo, pueda  trabajar para tener sus propios a horros para sostener a su  familia y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Mercedes lives in Morelia, in Coapilla.  She is married to Galileo and they have three children who are still in their care.

This is the third time that María has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise with which to stock her grocery store.  She tells us that, in spite of the fact that she has owned her business for just one year, it is doing well and she can see that it is providing her with good results.

María made the decision to start her business as she knew that it was a good business which would make her good income for her household.  The loan that she has requested will enable her to continue working.

María's biggest wish is to be able to work (with her business and her loan) in order to build her own savings with which to support her family and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, eggs, oil, beans, milk and other products with which to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes, vive en la ribera Morelia, municipio de Coapilla, ella es casada con el señor jais y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes dos ya están casados y tres aun vive con ella, y son: baltazaretti  de diesi seis años de edad, marco Antonio  de doce años  y la ultima es estrella yuriana de cinco años de edad,


     Ella se de doca a la elaboración de  dulce, como son: dulces de nuégado, chilacayote, como también elabora tamales  de hoja de guineo para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes de cada una de sus actividades, en este trabajo lleva  cuatro años y siete meses en la que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello obtiene ingresos para su hogar.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por si sola ya que también quiere apoyar a su espeso con lo ingresos  ya si juntos sacar adelante a su familia  dándole lo más necesario en su educación.

   Lo que desea es que la sigan poyando con el crédito para continuar trabajando so su pequeña actividad que es con lo que se poya para tener ingresos y de eso mismo los apoya para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is married to Jais and they live on the shore of the Morelia, town of Coapilla.  They have four sons and daughters, two who are married, and three that still live with them.  They are: Baltazaretti, sixteen, Marco Antonio, twelve, and the youngest, Estrella Yuriana, five.

She makes sweets such as walnut and chilacayote (a tropical fruit) candies, and also prepares tamales in banana leaves (wrapped corn dough with other foods) to sell in the same stand.  She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for each of these foods.  Maria has been doing this work for four years and six months and she says that it’s going well and gives her earnings for her household.

She was inspired to start this work for herself and also she wanted to help her husband with the income.  She wants to improve the life of her family by giving them what is the most necessary, education.

She wants to continue and the loan will help her keep working in her little business that gives her some money and lets her children go on in their schooling.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make tamales (corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) with mole (sauce of many ingredients) and walnut and chilacayote (a tropical fruit) sweets.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 42 years of age and married with five children. Lusia has a banana plantation. She has many years of experience in this business. Lusia needs a loan of 1000 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. 

She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas, or about $104 US per week) to improve and expand the business. 

In 2011, Lusia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lusia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, vive en  Morelia Municipio de Coapilla, vive en unión libre con el señor Pedro y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad: Julieta de once años  en quinto de primaria, el otro es Neftalí  de nueve años, María del Carmen de cuatro años, aron de dos años y la más pequeña que esta por nacer.

   Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropas ya que en la actividad que tenia anterior mente ya no le funciono y decidió cambiar en lo de ropas para que así salga a venderla en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad,

   Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya que una de sus hermanas que vive en tecpatan le estará surtiendo para que ella solo lo venda en  otras comunidades y así se poye con os ingresos de su hogar y le pueda dar una mejor atención a su pequeña que esta por nacer.

  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda y tener sus propios ahorros para que con ello logre agrandar su negocio y pueda seguirá apoyando a su hijos que están creciendo.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Morelia, in Coapilla, with her common-law husband Pedro.  They have four children who are still in their care: 11 year-old Julieta, who is in fifth grade; 9 year-old Neftalí; 4 year-old María del Carmen, 2 year-old Aaron and their youngest who is not yet born.

Juana is a housewife and she requested this loan to invest in buying clothes.  Her previous business activity did not work out and so she decided to make a change and start selling clothes.  She sells her goods in nearby communities to her own.

Juana decided to start this business as one of her sisters who lives in Tecpatan will supply her with merchandise to sell in other communities.  In this way, she will help contribute income to her household and will be able to provide more attention to her youngest child who is yet to be born.

What Juana most desires is to be able to build up some of her own savings through her small business so that she can expand the business and continue supporting her growing children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Manuel Asencio

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 37 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y turismo.

Manuel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa, para su mayor seguridad y comodidad, además puede atender a sus clientes a cualquier hora.  Con las ganancias que obtenga por las ventas de sus productos podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Para poder ampliar un poco más su negocio necesita efectivo, por lo mismo ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para su tienda y así tener contentos a sus clientes, con la intención de que se incrementen sus ventas para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 and currently lives with his wife and child. He has his own home which has electricity and water, and is located in the district of Chepen in the department of La Libertad. This zone is characterized by agriculture, farming, business and tourism. 

Miguel has worked for several years selling groceries from him home, for better security and comfort and also being able to attend to his clients at whatever hour. With the earnings from his sales he covers the needs of his household. 

The growing demand that Manuel's shop has been experiencing has caused him to consider expanding it by purchasing more products, thus he thought it was a good idea to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1,500 soles. 

Manuel is a responsible and enterprising person. He would like to grow as a business owner and be able to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, sugar, and noodles for her grocery store

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad, Beatriz R. es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, el cual comenzó hace 1 año cuando montó una tienda donde vende productos de la canasta familiar, en un sector muy reconocido y comercial del municipio de Bello en el departamento de Antioquia.

Beatriz es una luchadora incansable que espera tener más clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtido y con gran variedad en los productos. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo es una bendición ya que ella dispone de su tiempo, se ha vuelto una mujer responsable y dedicada, vive el día a día con la ilusión de sacar adelante su negocio y brindarles a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida, trabaja de lunes a domingo de 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m.  Actualmente Beatriz necesita de un préstamo para comprar un surtido generoso para su tienda y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, así mismo incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente las utilidades.
texts.en:
Forty-year-old Beatriz Roldan is a dedicated entrepreneur. She went into business a year ago, when she started selling everyday grocery items in a well-known commercial district of Bello, Antioquia. 

Beatriz is always working hard for more customers and new opportunities to keep her general store well-stocked and improve the variety of her merchandise. She believes her work is a blessing that has given her the chance become a responsible, dedicated businesswoman. Day-to-day, she dreams of growing her business and offering her two children a better quality of life. 

Beatriz works Monday to Sunday, 6:00 AM - 10:00 PM. This loan will help her buy a variety of products for her store and offer better selection to her customers, all while increasing her store's popularity and profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of staples for her general store.

loans.name: Orlandina

texts.es:
La señora Orlandina, habita en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo, ella es comerciante vende ropa y zapato lleva 10 años en este negocio. Ella se fue a los Estados Unidos en el año 1988 trabajo y ahorro, de regreso su pueblo compro su casa  y una finca además puso una tienda de ropa y zapatos la cual ella misma administra y atiende con ayuda de su esposo. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar zapatos, con el objetivo de mantener surtida su tienda de nuevos productos para ofrecer, atraer más clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener un buen record crediticio. En sus planes futuros ella desea poner un salón de belleza, dedicarse a vender zapatos pues dice que tiene más ganancia la venta de este producto. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Orlandina lives in Pueblo Nuevo, municipality of Estelí, Nicaragua. She is 45 years old, married and has a son. She has sold clothing and shoes for the past 10 years. She want to the United State in 1988 to work and save, and upon returning to her town she bought her home and some land and set up her store, which she herself administers and tends to with the help of her husband. She is requesting the loan to purchase shoes, with the objective to keep her store stocked with new products to offer, to attract more customers, to increase her sale and to have a good credit history. In the future, she hopes to set up a beauty salon and dedicate herself to selling shoes, since she says she makes more profits selling that product. Her next goal is to improve her business' infrastructure.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Aulagia

texts.en:
Aulagia is 41 years of age. She is married with two children. Aulagia owns and operates a business catching and selling ocean fish. She has many years of experience in this business. Aulagia needs a loan of $1,000 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $220 tala, or $92 USD, per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Aulagia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aulagia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Silvia Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia vive por la parroquia de Turi, parroquia que es conocida por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y cordiales.
 
La Señora. Silvia es muy joven tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como ebanista, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su abuelita con a quien le hace compañía y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Silvia labora en su negocio propio, ella confeciona delantales, trabaja en su casa y lleva en esta actividad 2 años y labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para seguir con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Silvia lives in the parrish of Turi, which is known for its views of the city. Its people make a living in commerce, raising livestock and agriculture, and are very friendly and cordial. Silvia is a young woman of 23 years old, lives with her partner and has a 2-year-old son. Her husband works as a cabinetmaker. They don't have their own home, so they live with a grandmother, who keeps them company and helps with household expenses. Silvia works at her own business, making aprons at home for the past two years. She works from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. This is her first loan with a community bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. With the loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of fabric to keep moving forward with the business. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Doña Ignacia, vive en  la localidad de nuevo Naranjo Municipio de Tecpatan, es casada con el señor  Reynaldo  y con quien procreo una hija de nombre flor violeta de seis años de edad.

    Ella dedica a la compra y venta de pollos de granja para posteriormente venderlo  en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva un dos años y cometa que le va bien ya que con ello está logrando tener sus propios ingresos a un que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se encuentra trabajando fura ella también quiere aportar con algo de dinero.

      Inicio por  su propia idea ya que  para ahorra el dinero que le manda su esposo  tenía que tener una idea de cómo trabajarlo y así darle un buen rendimiento para sostener su hogar.

      Su más grande  ilusión es que con su actividad y sus ganancias pueda incrementar día a día sus ingresos y su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Ignacia lives in Nuevo Naranjo, municipality of Tecpatan, Mexico. She's married to Raynaldo, with whom she has a daughter, 6-year-old Flor Violeta. Ignacia has made a living buying and selling chickens for the past two years and says that it's going very well since she has been able to earn her own income to support her husband, who is currently away working. She also wants to make money for herself. She started on her own idea so she could save money to send to her husband. She had to get a good idea of how to work so she could perform well and provide for her household. Her biggest goal is for her business and her income to grow day by day.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna vive en nuevo Naranjo Municipio de Tecpatan estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada con el señor  Lorenzo y con quien procreo tres hijos y son: Meliara de diesi siete años de edad, María Dolores de quince años y el  más pequeño  es Adán de trece años.

   Ella se dedica a la compra y venta  de ganados, engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo, en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con  ello ha estado trabajando los un poco de los ingresos  que la da su esposo  ya que le se cuentra trabajando fuera de la localidad.

   Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo trabajando y juntos sacara adelante a su pequeña familia  que s lo mas importante para ellos  darle un bien estar mejor.
 
   Su deseo es que  con esta  actividad y el préstamo que solicito pueda incrementar más su actividad  y sus ahorros sea mejor cada día.
texts.en: Reyna lives in Nuevo Naranjo, municipality of Tecpatan, Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Lorenzo, with whom she has three children: daughters Meliara, 16, and María Dolores, 15; and son Adán, 13. Reyna has made a living buying and selling cattle to fatten and then sell for the past three years and says that it is going well since she has given a little of the income to her husband, who is currently away working. She was inspired to start this activity since she wanted to support her husband and together make headway for the family since the most important thing is giving the children a better quality of life. Her goal is with the loan she can expand her business and her savings can grow every day.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora Medida  es de la  localidad de nuevo naranjo, ella es casada con el señor Benjamín con quien procreo tres hijos  quienes Alisvediana de dieciseis años de edad y Fernando  de quince años  de edad a un vive con ella pero ya son dependientes de si ismo y que a un está a su responsabilidad es Daniela de nueve años.

   Ella ya a trabajo en otros créditos y en fundación es la primera ves que solicita un préstamo y es para invertirlo en la compra de ganados para luego venderlo en la región de igual manera es la primera vez que se dedica a esta actividad y es para tener un mejor resultado y ganancias en su hogar.

  Lo que lo inspiro en esta actividad fue su esposo  ya que el se encuentra trabajando fuera del país y lo que gana no lo quiere mal invertir en otra actividad  que no le dé resultado y por eso decidió la compra y venta de ganado ya que es lo único que le dejara un buen ahorro.

   su más grande deseo es que con el pollo y su actividad pueda seguir adelante y con la ayuda de su esposo podrá incrementar día con día su negocio y así salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Medida is from Nuevo Naranjo in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Benjamín, with whom she has had three children: Alisvediana, 16, and Fernando, 15, live with them but support themselves, while Daniela, 9, is still under Medida's care. Medida has worked with other loans and this is the first one she is requesting through the foundation, and it's to purchase cattle to later resell in the area. This is her first time doing this activity, and she hopes to have good results and have money for her household. Her husband inspired her to do this activity since he is working outside of the country and he doesn't want what he makes invested poorly in another activity without good results, so she decided to buy and sell livestock since it's the only one that will give her good earnings. Her biggest goal is that with chickens and this activity she can make headway and, with the help of her husband, she can grow her business day by day and make progress for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Ruth Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es muy visitada por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, es la tercera ciudad de más importante  del país, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Ruth tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 16, 15, 13, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión gasfitero (reparación  de tuberías), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Ruth se dedica al comercio de juguetes, labora en esta actividad de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, se encuentra en este negocio hace 2 años.
 
Este  el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  más juguetes para continuar en el negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth lives in the outskirts of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty and its architecture. It is the third most important city in the country. Locals and foreigners are captivated by the variety of cuisine. The people who live here maintain their culture and traditions.
Mrs. Ruth is 32 years old, married, with five children ages 16,15,13.10 and 8. The three oldest children go to high school and the younger ones study at a small school in their city. Her husband is a plumber (he repairs pipes). They don’t have their own house. They are leasing a house.
Mrs. Ruth sells toys. She works from Sunday to Sunday but doesn’t have a fixed schedule. She has been doing this work for the past two years.
This is her third loan from the Community Bank. A friend invited her to join the bank. She will use the loan to buy more toys in order to continue with her business.
Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta  is 49 years of age and married with eight children. Mareta owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Mareta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase farming supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 290 talas or US $121 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Mareta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mareta's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Siline

texts.en:
Siline is 36 years of age and married with four children. Siline  owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Siline needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Siline  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Siline 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Luz Vereniz

texts.es:
La señora  Luz Vereniz, vive en coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con un hijo de nombre Kevin Gabriel de dos años de edad.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y esta vez será para invertirlo en la compra de pollos de granja, para luego venderlo  destazado en la misma localidad, en esta actividad a un va inicias y espera que le dé un buen resultado para seguir trabajando con el préstamo.


   Su inspiración por esta actividad inicio ya que es una mujer sola con un hijo  y que quiere apoyarlo con lo
   Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y el préstamo logre tener sus propios ingresos para poder pagar el crédito y con las ganancias que bala obteniendo seguir trabajando y salir adelante con hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a single mother with a son named Kevin Gabriel who is two years old. 
This is the first time she has requested a loan. She would like to buy farm chickens and then sell their meat in her town. She is beginning this new activity and she hopes for good results in order to continue paying the loan.
Her inspiration for doing this activity is that she is a single mother with a child and she needs to support him.
Her desire is that with this activity, and the loan she has received, she will have her own earnings to be used to pay the loan. With the earnings she has achieved she will continue working and progress along with her child.

loans.use: to buy chickens that she will butcher.

loans.name: Luisa Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Luisa vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  es muy visitada por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, es la tercera ciudad de más importante  del país, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Luisa tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Luisa por el momento no se encuentra trabajando ya que esta dedicada al cuidado de sus hijos que son pequeños.

Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio que va a iniciar.
texts.en: Luisa lives in the outskirts of Cuenca, Ecuador. This city is a tourist attraction due to its natural beauty and architecture and is the third most important city in the country. It has a varied cuisine that captures natives and foreigners alike, and its people maintain their culture and traditions. Luisa is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has three children, ages 6, 4 and 1. Her eldest son goes to school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard, and they don't own a home so they rent. At the moment, Luisa is not working since she is dedicated to taking care of her young children. This is fourth loan from her community bank, and she plans to use it to invest in the purchase of chickens to start up that activity. Her goal is to grow this business that she is starting.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora se Carmen, vive en coapilla Chiapas, ella es casada con el señor Gabriel y con quien procreo cinco hijo quienes dos ya están casados y tres a un están a su responsabilidad  y son: José Alberto de veintidós años de edad, Benjamín de diesi ocho años y Patricia de diesi seis años de edad.

    Ella es la segunda vez que solicita un el préstamo con fundación realidad y es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: harina, huevo, aceite, leche, quesos, entre otros para la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva apenas seis meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado teniendo ingresos en su hogar.

     Ella aprendió con su mama y cuando se caso lo siguió practicando paro al paso del tiempo dejo de hacerlo por falta de economía y hace seis meses comenzó de nuevo y comenta que si le está yendo bien.

    Su deseo es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y así tenga sus propios ahorros para salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en: Carmen lives in Coapilla, Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Gabriel, with whom she has five children. Two of her kids are married, and the other three support themselves and are: José Alberto, 22; Benjamín, 18; and Patricia, 16. This is the second loan Carmen has requested from Kiva partner Fundción Realidad, and she plans to use it to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, milk, cheeses, among other items, to make her breads. She has been baking for six months and says that it is going well since she is making income for her household. She learned how to bake breads from her mother and when she married she kept working, but over time she stopped because of a lack of resources, but six months ago she started up again and it's going well. Her goal with this small business is to improve her quality of life and have her own savings to make headway for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients (flour, eggs, oil, milk, cheeses, etc.) to make her breads.

loans.name: Talita

texts.en:
Talita is 25 years of age and married with two children. Talita owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Talita needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Talita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Talita's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks like bongo's, cookies and twisties

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionicia, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con el señor  Daniel, en la cual procreo dos hijos: Daniela Judith de seis años y Kevin Gabriel de dos años de edad.

   Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva  un año practicándolo y dice que ve que le está yendo bien ya que le está dejando buenos ingresos y ganancias dentro de su actividad.

   Se inspiro en ello ya que lo aprendió con su suegra  y decidió practicarlo para tener sus propios ingresos y así poyar a su esposo con un poco de dinero, para que juntos le den lo mejor a sus dos hijos que están creciendo.

   Lo que ella desea  es que la apoyando  con el préstamo y así seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida y logre tener sus propios ahorros.
texts.en:
Dionisia lives in Coapilla, Chiapas, Mexico. She lives with her husband, Daniel, with whom she has two children: Daniela Judith, 6, and Kevin Gabriel, 2. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients to bake breads, which she has been doing for a year and says that it's going well since she's earning a good income. 

She motivated herself to start the job, which she learned from her mother-in-law, and decided to start doing it to earn her own income and support her husband with a little money so together they can give the best to their growing children. 

Dionisia hopes to get some support from the loan so she can keep working to improve her quality of life and have her own savings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients (eggs, oil, flour, cheese, etc.) to bake her breads.

loans.name: Pua

texts.en:
Pua is 46 years of age and married with seven children. Pua owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  She has 4 years of experience in this business. Pua needs a loan of WST $2500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Pua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pua's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Solidario El Campo Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO EL CAMPO.
EL GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR  MARTA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD ,REBECA Y URSULO, SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS, MARTA LIDIA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO Y ELABORACION DE FAJAS, PERO TAMBIEN TIENE VENTA DE TORTILLAS, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES TEJIDOS A MANO , REBECA, ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO PERO TAMBIEN CULTIVAN, URSULO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE GRANIZADAS, EL VENDE DE AMBULANTE, TODOS NECESITAN SU CREDITO PARA PODER OBTENER MATERIA PRIMA Y PODER OBTENER MAS VENTA Y MAS GANANCIAS Y DARLE UN MEJOR FUTURO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
"Solidario El Campo" [Rural Solidarity]

The group is made up of Marta, 35, Rebeca and Ursulo who have various businesses. Marta Lidia earns a living making huipiles (colorful Mayan tunics) and sashes by hand, but also sells tortillas. Her primary business activity is the weaving. Rebeca also earns a living making huipiles by hand, but also raises crops. Ursulo earns a living selling slushees (sweet crushed-ice beverages) as a street vendor. 

All of them require their loan in order to get supplies and increase their sales and profits, so as to give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making woven items.

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa is the president of a united group of three women entrepreneurs from the city of Ibarra, Ecuador. Jennifer and Silvia are the other two members of the group.

Elsa is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, mother, and three children who are 15, 14, and 11 years old. Elsa describes herself as an entrepreneurial working woman with "dreams of progress for my family."
 
Elsa operates her business from home, making and selling hats and bags made of sheep's wool. She learned her craft from her mother when she was 15 years old. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wool to make more hats and bags. 

Elsa believes that this loan will help her improve her business and her quality of life. Her dream is to move out of her mother's home and to own her own home, to continue her business, and have the prices of her bags and hats increase. 

In the group photo, Elsa is pictured in the middle knitting her products out of gray wool.

loans.use: to purchase wool to make hats and bags

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is 44 years of age and married with nine children. Emi owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Emi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Emi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Emi's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: El señor José Santos tiene 54 años, El señor José es dueño de un negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte personal. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 23 años, con una ruta que se dirige del viejo a Chinandega, pero como no estaba resultando decide ofrecer el servicio de transporte personal a una empresa es así que ha logrado salir adelante. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de llantas, focos, mantenimiento entre otros. El sueño de José es mejorar su servicio ya que la competencia es bastante grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 54 years old. He owns a private transportation business. He established this business 23 years ago when he provided transportation on the road from “Viejo” to “Chinandega”. When this wasn’t successful her decided to change his business to a personal transportation business. This business has been successful.  He is a very responsible man and enjoys his work. 
This loan will be used to buy tires, headlights and to maintain his vehicle. His dream is to improve his service as he has a lot of competition.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlights and generally maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Toreka

texts.en:
Toreka is 44 years of age and married with seven children. Toreka owns & operates a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.  Toreka needs a loan of WST $2900 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2006, Toreka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toreka's 8th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 30 years of age and married with five children. Ana  owns & operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Ana  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Ana  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ana 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 43 years of age and married with five children. Rosalia owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Rosalia needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Rosalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Rosalia's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 34 years of age and married with two children. Veronika owns & operates a business venture, which is running a taxi to take people along in Samoa.  She has many years of experience in this business. Veronika needs a loan of WST $1450 to renew her vehicle license.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Veronika joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Veronika's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Tapuitea

texts.en:
Tapuitea is 34 years of age and married with one child. Tapuitea owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Tapuitea needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 193 talas or US $80 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tapuitea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tapuitea's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is 54 years of age and married with six children. Mareta owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling specialty goods & delicacies in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Mareta needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Mareta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mareta's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila  es una mujer D. 62 años D. edad, cuenta con un lugar propio para vivir que tiene los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicado en el caserío Tongorrape en el distrito D.  Olmos  y a más D. una hora D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Los pobladores la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura y ganadería.

Petronila se dedica desD. hace unos años al servicio D. la venta D. comida en su pequeño restaurante que ha colocado en la parte anterior D. su misma casa para mayor seguridad del mismo. Sus clientes son personas foráneas del lugar, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos D. su casa

Por eso ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la preparación D. su platos y así pueda ofrecer una variedad D. comidas y no unas cuantas, también para mejorar la infraestructura D. su negocio para que las personas que lleguen a comer allí se sientan cómodos, satisfechos con la atención y el servicio.

Petronila con su trabajo y sus ganas D. salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto D. sus vecinos, demostrando las ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Petronila is a 62-year-old woman who has her own living place with running water and electricity, located in the hamlet of Tongorrape in the district of Olmos, and more than an hour away from the province of Chiclayo. The area's inhabitants engage in the farming of crops and livestock. 

Some years ago Petronila began earning a living by providing the service of food sales in her small restaurant which she has installed in the front part of her own home in order to better secure it. Her customers are foreigners to the area. With the income she receives she will be able to cover her household costs. 

Thus she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,000 soles in order to purchase supplies for the preparation of her dishes, so she may offer a variety of foods and not just a few. It is also for improving her business's infrastructure so that the people who come to eat there may feel comfortable and satisfied with the service and the business. 

Petronila by her work and with her desire to get ahead has earned the confidence and respect of her neighbors, demonstrating the desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing her foods.

loans.name: Buscando El Exito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito está formado por 11 mujeres que son amigas y vecinas, trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias, son personas muy amables y cordiales. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad muy culta y llena de tradiciones,  cuenta con una variada gastronomía y también es reconocida por ser  cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas.

La Señora. Rosa vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 55 años, esta  separada y tiene 6 hijos de 33, 30, 26, 24, 17, 15 años de edad, tres de sus hijos son  casados e independientes, su segundo hijo es soltero, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa hace 6 años se dedica a vender pinchos (carne en palito) y maduros asados, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a limpiar de casas y a lavar ropa.

En el banco comunal está en su cuarto crédito y fue invitada por su sobrina a ser parte del mismo, el dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de carne, papas, plátano verde, aceite, salchichas, cebollas, pimientos, pinchos de madera, etc. para incrementar y crecer en su negocio. 

Su meta es tener una tienda. 

En la foto nos acompaña un chico que está vestido con una chompa negra con mangas rojas, es el hijo una de las socias. Los otros niños tambien son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
Eleven women who are friends and neighbors established the “Seeking Success” Community Bank. They work in different businesses, but all the business help them to economically support their homes and progress with their families. They are friendly and cordial people. They live in different places in Cuenca City, a city very sophisticated and full of traditions. They city has a variety of cuisine and it is also known for its great poets and athletes.
Mrs. Rosa lives in the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 55 years old, separated from her husband and has six children ages 33, 30, 26, 24, 17, 15. Three of her children are married and independent. Her second son is single, works, and helps her economically. Her last two children attend high school in the city. They don’t have their own home. They lease a house.
For the past six years Mrs. Rosa has been selling brochettes (meat on a stick) and roasted plantains. She works from Monday to Saturday but she doesn’t have a fixed schedule. She also cleans houses and washes clothes.
This is her fourth loan with the community bank. She was invited by her niece to be part of the bank. The money from the loan will be used to buy meat, potatoes, green plantains, oil, sausages, pimentos, wood sticks, etc. She wants to increase and grow her business. 
Her goal is to have a store.
In the photo there is a boy that is dressed in a black sweater with red sleeves. This is the son of one of the members. The other children also belong to the members.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, green plantains, oil, sausages, onions, pimentos, wood sticks, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es una padre de familia de 41 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estos lugares desarrollan la actividad agícola, ganadera y turismo.

Gerardo es agricultor desde hace varios años, cuenta con varias hectáreas de terreno en los cuales cultiva frijol, este producto es muy rentable y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona, a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto y así pueda seguir creciendo su negocio e incrementando sus ganancias.

Gerardo es un hombre responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo desea que su familia salga adelante y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a 41 year old father.  He lives with his wife and children.  He has his own house, and the only service it has is electricity.  It is in the rural zone of the Tambogrande district, which is 40 minutes from the Piura department.  Everyone in these places works in agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Gerardo has been a farmer for several years.  He has various hectares of land where he grows beans.  This product is very profitable.  Once he harvests it, he sells the crop at the different markets in the area.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternative as seed money.  He will buy fertilizers to improve his farmland and his product.  That way he will continue to grow his business and to increase his earnings.

Gerardo is a responsible and hard-working man. Through his efforts he wishes that his family gets ahead and that his children have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his farmland.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene  64 años es casada, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes, vive en casa propia solo con su cónyuge quien se dedica a trabajos de albañilería, la comunidad en la que vive es urbana de tamaño regular ubicada en el distrito de Mochumi, cuenta con servicio de agua y energía eléctrica.

Rosa María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Rosa María ha venido experimentando una fuerte demanda en su negocio, debido a esto Rosa María piensa  ampliar el negocio adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles, para lograr sus objetivos

Rosa María es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 64, is married and has three children who already live independently.  She lives in her own house just with her spouse who works doing jobs as a bricklayer.  The community where she lives is urban and of regular size located in Mochumí District.  She has both water and electricity.

Rosa María has a small home-based grocery store that she tends to herself.  She offers neighbors and customers from the area various daily use products, first need and groceries among them.  The business is well received and she helps her husband support the family with income from this business.

Rosa María has been experiencing strong demand in her store.  Because of this she plans to expand the store acquiring more products and because of this she’s thought it advisable to request a 300 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goals.

Rosa María is quite a well known and esteemed person by local residents.  People who know her consider her to be calm and quite responsible.

loans.use: to buy new stock items for her store.

loans.name: Juarez Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, ella tiene  02 hijas, con las cuales vive en casa propia, dicha casa está ubicada en la Caserío Palominos distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. Teodora vive en la parte rural de este distrito, y cuenta con servicio de luz.

Teodora  se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral; esta actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años y cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos, para desarrollar dicha actividad, los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando el ganado alcanza el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.Complementariamente trabaja en un fundo de Maracuyá y con estas actividades ella cubre las necesidades de sus hogar.

Teodora está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder invertir en la compra de mas animales para su engorde, con su respectivo alimento balanceado.

Teodora es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Teodora is a 33-year-old mother; she has two daughters living with her in her own house which is located in the Palominos hamlet, Tambogrande District in Piura.  Teodora lives in the rural part of this district and she has electricity.

Teodora raises sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl to sell.  She’s been in this line of work for 7 years and has appropriate, spacious corrals for this activity located in her back yard.  When the animals reach ideal size and weight she sells them at the local market.  She’s also employed at a passion fruit large farming firm and with these activities is able to meet household needs.

Teodora is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more animals to raise as well as to buy their respective feed.

Teodora is quite a hard working woman who strives daily to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her to be a kind person who is always willing to help others.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Elvis Paul

texts.es:
Elvis de 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el  zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la misma que se  encuentra en el departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad de agricultura , ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace 2 años Elvis se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales (ovejas y cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus animales se venden rápido en los mercados que los ofrece por estar bien alimentados con comida balanceada y pastos naturales,  lo cual le permite aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.  

Por lo mismo Elvis a solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para la compra de animales y su respectiva comida. Al incrementar sus ventas podrá solventar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Elvis es conocido por los comerciantes de la zona y en de los distintos mercados donde ofrece sus productos por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y con muchas ganas de  mejorar en la vida, para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Elvis, 21, is single living with his parents in their house that only has electricity located in the rural part of Tambogrande District which is itself located in Piura Department.  This district is notable because its residents farm, raise livestock and are craftsmen.

For the last two years Elvis has been buying, raising and selling animals (sheep and pigs).  His corral is located in the rear of his house for better security and comfort.  His animals sell quickly at the markets he sells them at because they are well fed with nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses which allows him to increase his profits to meet daily needs.

For this reason, Elvis has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy animals and their respective feed.  By increasing his sales he’ll be able to repay the loan and improve his quality of life.

Elvis is knows by all the local merchants and in the various markets where he sells his products for being an honest, hard working man with a strong drive to improve his life to continue helping his parents economically.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
Betzabe tiene 21 años de edad, el cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en un caserío del  distrito de Tambogrande en Piura ,es un caserío mediano con deseos de superación.

Betzabe  se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, atendiendo todos los días de la semana en su negocio el cual ha instalado en su casa, además se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral. Los cuales los comercializa cuando tienen el tamaño y peso ideal.

Betzabe está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  nuevos soles  para la comprar mercadería para surtir su bodega y atender a sus clientes en un menor tiempo, y así seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Betzabe Adela es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad, pues la consideran una mujer trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Betzabe is 21 years old. She has her own house, which is located in a neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande in Piura. It is a medium-sized neighborhood where people have the desire to get ahead.

Betzabe works selling products of basic everyday use. She works every day of the week in her business, which she has set up in her home. In addition, she also raises domestic birds, which she sells when they reach the ideal size and weight. 

Betzabe is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles, to buy merchandise to stock her store and serve her customers more rapidly. This will help her continue to grow with her business. 

Betzabe Adela is a person who is devoted to her home and family and held in high esteem by the people of her community, since they consider her a hard-working and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús procedente de San Estanislao en el departamento de Bolívar,  tiene 42 años de vivir en la ciudad de Barranquilla y 47 años de edad;  él es microempresario y  junto a su cónyuge vende ropa y calzado de marcas muy reconocidas, sobre  pedidos que le hace su clientela, aplicando la modalidad de ventas a crédito.  Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en el barrio El Milagro, la cual es de dos pisos, uno lo constituye su espacio familiar y productivo y el segundo piso lo tiene arrendado. Sus clientes principales son amigos, referidos, oficinistas y familiares, otorga  plazos que oscilan entre los 15 y 45 días,  tiene una motocicleta que utiliza para comprar y vender sus mercancías y para realizar labores de cobro y toma de pedidos, se desplaza  unas veces solo y en otras ocasiones con su cónyuge. Además, él es maestro de obra, labor en la que devenga un ingreso mensual. Tiene una hija estudiante y en ella muchas esperanza de lograr ayudarla a que en un futuro sea exitosa. Su sueño es tener un punto de ventas para incrementar sus ingresos.
