Su credikiva es la primera financiación que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará calzado y ropa procedente de Bucaramanga y Medellín,  espera que esta inversión  incremente el inventario para mantener volúmenes de mercancías disponibles para la demanda esperada. Jesús trabaja para lograr sus sueños y los de su familia continua manteniendo su negocio con una rotación de inventarios de 18 días, la de sus cuentas por cobrar es 26 días y maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventase de 22,19%.
texts.en:
Jesús is from San Estanislao, in Bolívar department.  He has lived in the city of Barranquilla for 42 years and is 47 years old.  Jesús is a small businessman and, together with his wife, he sells very well-known brands of clothes and footwear.  He fills orders that his customers make with him and sells his goods on credit.  Jesús' business is located in his own home, in El Milagro neighborhood.  His home has two floors, one is his family space and work space and the other is rented out.

Jesús' main customers are friends, people who he has been recommended to, office workers and family members.  He allows his customers to pay in instalments which vary between 15 and 45 days.  Jesús has a motorcycle that he uses when buying and selling his merchandise and also when collecting payment and taking orders.  Sometimes he travels by himself and, on other occasions, his wife accompanies him.  In addition, Jesús works as a master builder.  This work makes him a monthly income.

Jesús has a daughter who is studying and he hopes to be able to help her become successful in the future.  Jesús' dream is to have a proper sales location so that he can increase his income.  This Kiva loan is his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy footwear and clothes from Bucaramanga and Medellín.  He hopes that this investment will help him increase his inventory so that he can have merchandise available with which to meet demand.  Jesús is working to achieve his own dreams and those of his family.  His business has a stock turnover of 18 days.  His accounts receivable period is 26 days and he maintains a sales profitability of 22.19%.

loans.use: to buy footwear and clothes in greater quantities

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou, a 23-year-old fisherman, is from Siem Reap Province and the father of one child who is still young and lives under his care. 

Early every morning, Nou goes to the middle of the river to fish using a various tools. After he is done fishing, he quickly brings his fish by motorbike to the market for resale. For additional income, Nou’s wife works in a local hotel providing massage services for guests. 

Nou is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fishing equipment, such as a new boat and nets, so he can continue fishing and catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 40 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family.  She has been running her store for 24 years and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

Analyn is requesting a loan for PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy items such as biscuits, groceries and other basic commodities to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has successfully repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF.  Analyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea lives in a small house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer, and she always plants her crops in the field according to the season, whether the rainy season or dry season. Her husband runs a motor taxi service at the busy market. They earn a profit of approximately of US$3.60 per day to use for their expenses.

Mrs. Chea is asking for her first loan in order to plant vegetables and rice. The couple is blessed with a kid who is enrolled in school. In the future, Mrs. Chea has planned to expand her crop-planting business, to enlarge her current house, and to support her only child to finish a high level of education.

loans.use: to plant vegetables and rice

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 33 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  With all 3 children in school, Loida works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  She sells a variety of items such as noodles, curls, spices, etc.  

Loida has requested a loan for PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as sardines, groceries, etc in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: purchase items to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 27 years.   She  also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. 

Luzviminda  is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy a planer and other materials for her furniture-making business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a planer and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 31 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  For 14 years, she has earned a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Elena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough for her business expansion and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.   She makes a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling meat products.

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and medicines for her pigs

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Nena works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.   Nena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish business.  

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cheese, meat, and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Nelsie Grace

texts.en:
Nelsie Grace is 47 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 1 of whom is in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelsie Grace has a bakery business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 8 years.  She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.  Lucy is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business and to repair of her food stall.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy cooking ingredients and repair her food stall

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 41 years old and married with three children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nilda has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening and fishing.

Nilda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mr. Cheng, age 30, is a Tuk Tuk driver who picks up passengers to visit interesting places in and around Siem Reap Province. For his motor service, he can receive a high fee from his customers as he is very skilled. 

For additional family income, Mr. Cheng’s wife sells breakfast food, Khmer noodle, to the neighbors in her community and she also plants crops on her farmland according to the seasons. Their two children still study in school. Mr. Cheng will be using his loan to assist his wife to hire a machine for plowing on the farm so she can begin to plant her crop.

loans.use: to hire a machine for plowing

loans.name: Jonife

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jonife works hard to support her family.

She has a balut (fertilized duck eggs) making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising ducks.  Jonife is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more eggs and materials to enlarge her workplace for her balut making business.

Jonife has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her child to school.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and materials to enlarge her workplace

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 42 years old and lives in Antonio, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Eufemia has a general store where she sells various products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc.

Eufemia has been a member of PMPC for twoyears.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as soap, toothpaste and shampoo

loans.name: Mirela Luz

texts.es: Mírela vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 13 a19 años de edad;  allí tiene varios negocios, por un lado hace 7 años inició con la venta de comidas rápidas y almuerzos, así mismo a este mercado agregó el de venta de productos mediante guías especializadas y como si fuera poco  también ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras; en todos ellos su mercado principal  son  las mujeres de las familias, que interactúan en los diferentes negocios.  Su experiencia de negocio la adquirió en empresas donde trabajó como empleada y despertó su espíritu emprendedor que puso en marcha con muy poco capital, con el que gradualmente ha ido creciendo y todo esto con la ayuda de su cónyuge quien le ha apoyado en trabajo y motivación. Su sueño es  tener su propio local para crear una empresa de comidas rápidas, generar empleo,  y sobre todo para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento comprará utensilios de cocina, ollas, platos, sillas, mesas para mejorar la infraestructura física de su negocio de alimentos. Mientras Mírela le aporta trabajo a la consecución de su sueño, continua manejando un margen de utilidad no menor de un 30%,  que persiste en aumentarlo para lograr ayudar a sus hijos en la educación universitaria, porque continua con la esperanza de que estos sean apoyados por el estado nacional en la carrera universitaria que a ellos les guste.
texts.en:
Mirela lives in the July 20th neighborhood with her husband and three children who range in age from 13 to 19. It is here that she manages several businesses. She launched her first business seven years ago selling fast food and lunches. From that point, she also began selling products through specialized catalogs and renting out washing machines. Her main target customers are women with families, and each of her businesses reaches out to that demographic. Mirela gained her experience while working as an employee for different companies. This sparked her entrepreneurial spirit despite the fact that she had very little capital. Her resources gradually increased over time. She has been able to accomplish all of this with the full support of her husband and the motivation he provides. Her dream is to have her own shop where she can establish her fast food business and generate jobs so that all of her children can get ahead.

This is Mirela’s first loan. She will use the Kiva funds to buy cooking utensils, pots, plates, chairs, and tables to improve the physical infrastructure of her food business. While she continues to work toward achieving her dream, Mirela is able to maintain a minimum profit margin of 30%. She strives to improve on those results so that she can help her children obtain a university education. Mirela is hopeful that the state will allow them to enroll in any of the national universities they wish to attend.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils, pots, plates, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 25 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising livestock for nine years and earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Thuấn's Group

texts.en:
Thuấn is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thuấn is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc nhóm 05 (5).


Thuấn is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Thuấn owns & operates a business making & selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  Thuấn has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


Thuấn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy raw materials for production of beds, wardrobes, tables, chairs, purchase additional inventory & for working capital.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Thuấn from SEDA.  Thuấn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lịch is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to buy food for her pigs and chickens. 

2.  Yến is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to buy food for her pigs.


3.  Quý is a 58-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Cường is a 28-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his furniture making business.


5.  Quang is a 24-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business making furniture like tables and chairs.


6.  Phương is a 33-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business raising pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuấn là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thuấn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm 05 (5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuấn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuấn kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND.  Thuấn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu sản xuất giường tủ, bàn, ghế.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lịch  là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi và mua thức ăn cho lợn gà.


2.  Yến là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Quý là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Cường là 28 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Quang  là 24 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


6.  Phương là 33 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy raw materials and additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is a widow and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy steel bars, plain sheets and other materials for her sidecar.

Rosalia has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rosalia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy steel bars, plain sheets and other materials for her sidecar

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
Mrs. Pel is a 39-year-old womA. who earns a living by tailoring for her neighbors in both modern and traditional styles. She has a kiosk in front of her house for serving her customers. 

She has many years experience in the tailoring business and is making about $1.50 each day. In addition to this, she has been planting rice on her own farmland. 

Mrs. Pel is married to Mr. Seng, 38, a cattle seller, and they have seven children. Mrs. Pel will use her loA. to buy more cloth for her tailoring service.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for her tailoring service.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 65 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Yolanda has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from buying and selling  petroleum products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Frecil

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Frecil works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from vegetable farming.  Frecil is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production and vending business.

Frecil has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is single and very responsible. He is now 26 years old and has a food selling business.

Cesar sells food like snacks and daily meals to the people in his community. He has been in this business for almost one year.

Cesar is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase beverages, groceries, raw ingredients to cook and additional kitchen utensils.

In the future, Cesar hopes to make his business grow to earn income for the sake of his family and his future. He believes that with the continuous assistance of the Kiva lenders, he can achieve his business goals.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, groceries, raw ingredients to cook and additional kitchen utensils

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business.

Gloria has been in this business for 15 years. Gloria earns more income from pig fattening.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with five children. Veronica is 58 years old and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Veronica produces and sells sugar in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 to purchase raw materials for her sugar cane maker.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her sugar maker

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase small fish for breeding.

loans.name: Clodemer

texts.en:
Clodemer is a responsible father with 2 school-aged children.  He is 41 years old and has had a food selling business for almost 3 years. 

Clodemer sells food like cheese burgers to the people in his community.  Each month he earns about PHP 4,000 in this kind of business.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients to prepare his cheese burgers.

In the future, Clodemer hopes to strengthen this kind of business in order to earn more income and support the needs of his family especially for the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients in preparing cheese burgers for sale

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is 51 years old and is married with 5 children.

Laureta works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Laureta has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Laureta aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old and married with 8 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farming tools.

Marilyn has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: the repair and renovation her family home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming tools

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 64 years old and lives in P-3, Sebac, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with five children.

Bernardita has a retail store that sells a variety of products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and etc.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap to sell in her store.

Bernardita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Unsun

texts.en:
Unsun is 52, married and has three children.  Her husband works as a taxidriver.  Unsun has been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating since 1981, which was started with initial capital of 1.000 KGS.   

She worked hard to develop her business in fattening and reselling cattle and she also cultivated vegetables and sold it at the local market.  With the revenues, she was able to pay for the education of her daughter. 

To further develop her small farm, which now has two milk cows and calves, Unsun is applying for a loan of 40.000 KGS to purchase cattle.  It will allow her to broaden her business and raise the sales of meat and milk products.
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a welding shop business in the Philippines for 6 years. She also earns income from pig fattening. Lyn, who  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, is now borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her welding shop. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her welding shop.

loans.name: Michael Joseph

texts.en:
Michael Joseph, a 30-year-old married father of one infant-aged child, earns about PHP 30,000 per cropping season as a farmer planting and harvesting rice for sale in the Philippines. In this business for three years, he also raises hogs for additional income. Michael Joseph is now requesting a loan of PHP 15000 to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his farm and to buy feeds and medicines to sustain his hogs.

In the future, Michael Joseph would like to make his business more profitable to provide a progressive living for his family and to save funds for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his farm and to buy feeds and medicines for his hogs.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en: Married and with a fish-vending business in the Philippines, Jenie works hard to support three children. She has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking for her family. In addition to saving money, Jenie is also aware that using the Cookstove will help the environment and reduce health and fire hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new tuk tuk (motorcycle taxi) for her husband.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco-sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Elena is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks of tobacco to sell.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Ly Nhan-1-6 Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1982. She lives in Ly Nhan village, Duc Tu commune. She is married with 2 children. Her husband is a truck driver and has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

Miss Huong has a restaurant. She sells beer, fruit, etc. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid loans punctually. She is the group leader of a 5-member loan group.She wants to borrow  5,014,000 Vietnamdong (VND) to invest in her restaurant.

About the other borrowers in her group:
 Doanh is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 Nhien is 49 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs.
 Dung is 24 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her business.
 Phuoc is 31 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: to invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Maria Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Maria Lourdes is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell and ingredients for her food production business.

Maria Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell and ingredients for her food production business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana (in the photo), 28, is a tailor. Her husband, Saran, 28, is a truck driver. They have been married since 2003 and have two young sons. The family lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ratan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Tessie is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Tessie has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. Tessie requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy shirts, slippers and other dry goods to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Tessie would like to save to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, slippers and other dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Liezel is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, and medicines for her pigs. Liezel has been raising livestock for eight years and also earns additional income from basket weaving. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines, and medicines for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. .Evelyn is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds for her pigs and piglets  She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could expand her mini-grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Olinda Maria

texts.es: Olinda vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en el barrio Carrizal con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 33 a 35 años, todos ellos  trabajadores independientes, que han aprendido la actividad de empredimiento de su madre, quien se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a la venta de almuerzos especialmente de sancochos costeños, preparados con verduras y con una, dos o tres clases de carnes. Ella iniciò este negocio despues de  haber tenido una tienda donde desperdiciaban la verdura,  el hueso y la costilla de res pegada a este. Desde ese momento empezó a hacer sopas y a venderlas , ayudada por sus hijos, pues en la tienda diariamente tenia mas de 50 compradores. Una vez posicionada  la venta de almuerzos arrendó su tienda con toda su infraestructura y decidió quedarse con este último, debido a todo el trabajo que representan estos dos negocios al mismo tiempo.  En la actualidad Olinda está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo  pues quiere fortalecer su negocio de comidas y por eso ampliara su capital de trabajo mediante un credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen,  viveres, bebidas, arroz, granos y en general insumos para la preparaciòn de sus comidas, pues sabe que al comprar en efecivo y en mayor cuantia obtendra muy buenos descuentos y esto le generará ingresos superiores a los actuales y continuará incrementando su margen de utilidad que en la actualidad es no menor de un 20%.
texts.en:
Olinda lives in the neighborhood of Carrizal in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 33 and 35. All of her children work independently and have learned to be just as enterprising as their mother. For the past 20 years, Olinda has been selling lunches, especially coastal stews that are prepared with vegetables and up to three types of meat. She started this business after managing a store where she threw out vegetables, bones, and beef ribs. At that moment, she began making soups and selling them with the help of her children. Olinda sold them every day from her store and would have more than 50 customers. As soon as she was in a position to start selling lunches, Olinda put her entire store up for lease and decided to stick with her new venture. All of the work she has accomplished is represented by these two businesses.

Olinda is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she wants to strengthen her food business and increase her operating capital with Kiva funds. She will buy in bulk provisions, drinks, rice, grain, and general supplies for preparing her dishes. Olinda knows that buying in large amounts is more effective because she can obtain very good discounts, generate better earnings, and continue improving her profit margin which is currently at a minimum of 20%.

loans.use: to purchase provisions, drinks, rice, grain, and general supplies in bulk for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, age 44, is married with four children, two of whom are themselves married. One of their single children is a sewing worker. 

She is a domestic rice farmer in the Prey Chor district. Aside from her current occupation, she also sells sugar cane juice in front of her house for extra income as the photo above shows. 

Her husband is a motor taxi driver in the local market and earns a profit of about $1.50 per day. Usually Seng generates around $1.60 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. 

Previously she prepared the wedding party for one of her children, but hasn't paid for some of the expenses yet. This is the main reason she has decided to seek a loan: to pay the remaining wedding-ceremony expenses.

loans.use: to repay expenses from a wedding ceremony

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean and his wife, Sotom,  live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children. The couple has been farming for almost 10 years. They grow mushrooms, lotus, and rice. Mean is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy two buffaloes for plowing his farmland.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes for plowing his farmland.

loans.name: Mirlan

texts.en:
Mirlan is an entrepreneurial young man who is engaged in cattle breeding. Being a responsible person and grateful son, he stayed in his native village to support his elderly parents. Mirlan started his business using initial capital of 50,000 soms (KGS) and bought cattle. With hard work and great effort, Mirlan managed to increase the number of cattle and today he has one milk cow, one horse, five goats, and five sheep. He earns about 8,000 KGS a month, which was spent on medical treatment for his father. 

Mirlan is requesting loan of 50,000 KGS to buy three calves for fattening and reselling. He is eager to broaden his business because he plans to renovate his family’s house and marry his girlfriend. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en: Sokleap is married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  They live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sokleap used to be a silk weaver, but she now sells sugar cane juice in front of a garment factory located in Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a construction worker. Sokleap is requesting for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Duc Tu-1-6 Group

texts.en:
Hang is 29 years old, married, and has two children. They live in Duc Tu village.  Her husband is a truck driver. He has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Hang sells beef in the market, which she has been doing for eight years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She previously borrowed 5,014,000 VND frlom SEDA and repaid punctually. She is the leader of a five-member loan group. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy cows to resell.
 
Phuong is 30 years old. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her barber shop.

Van is 35 years old. She sells eggs in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014.000 VND.

Lien is 58 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy bananas to sell in the market.
 
Viet is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to purchase cows to resell.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy es un hombre casado que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 19 años. Èl se dedica al oficio de marroquinerìa, desarrollado como una forma de generar ingresos adicionales  con el que sueña ampliar para continuar fortaleciendo el bienestar de su Famiia. Fredy es un hombre muy trabajador, por eso cuando salió pensionado de las Fuerzas Armadas de Colombia, no dudò en dedicarse a una actividad que ademas de generarle entretenimiento,  le facilitara ganar un dinero extra y por ello se dedicó a capacitarse y se dió tambien a la tarea de emprender su propio negocio con lo que aprendió, y poco ha poco ha logrado sorprendentes resultados; ahora Fredy cuenta con un mercado al que le vende a crèdito y de contado y su aspiración es ampliarlo, adicionandole nuevas líneas de producción, porque su gran desafio es la competencia de mucho calzado barato en el mercado, no obstante sus capacidades comerciales, acompañada  de su vocacion emprendedora y de servicio, son la gran fortaleza con las que cuenta para obtener los logros previstos y responder a este desafio. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará cueros, accesorios y una máquina guarnecedora para mejorar los procesos productivos, aumentar la calidad de sus productos y con ello lograr el incremento de su mercado, al que auguramos un gran èxito por la disciplina y las habilidades negociadoras que Fredy imprime en cada momento productivo.
texts.en:
Fredy is a married man who has two children, ages 13 and 19. He is a leather craftsman who established his business as a way of generating extra income. His dream is to expand his business so that he can continue improving his family’s well-being. Fredy is a hard worker. When he retired from the Colombian Armed Forces with a pension, he did not hesitate in starting a business so that he could keep himself entertained and earn some additional money. Fredy decided to get some training and then established his business using what he had learned. Over time, he was able to achieve some surprising results.

Fredy now has a market for his products and sells them for cash or on credit. He has aspirations of expanding his business and offering new product lines. His greatest challenge is competition since there are many cheap shoes available for sale in the marketplace. Despite his lack of business experience, Fredy’s entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to service are his greatest strengths which will help him overcome this challenge.

This Kiva loan is the first one he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy leather, accessories, and an industrial sewing machine to improve his manufacturing processes for creating a high-quality product. As a result, he will be able to expand his market. One can predict that by being disciplined and utilizing his negotiating skills, Fredy will become a great success and make each moment a productive one.

loans.use: to purchase leather, accessories, and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La (in the photo) has been a construction worker for more than 20 years. His wife, Hay, has been selling vegetables in the local market for more than three years. They have one son and five daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment-factory workers, and the other three are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

La is asking for a loan of $500 to make a new roof for his house because the roof is old and breaking.

loans.use: to make a new roof for his house

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran, 51 years old, is a rice seller. She is a single mother with four children. Three of her children are studying and one is a motor taxi driver. 

Ran has sold rice since 1999. Her career has been able to support all her children's studies, but now that they are moving to the higher levels, she needs more income to support them. 

Before, she was the only one earning money to support the family, but now her first son is helping. Every day she can get $7 in income and her son can get $3. Each month she has to spend $45 on food, $13 on electricity, $15 on rent, $150 on school fees and $5 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a stock of rice to sell. With that loan, she hopes to get enough profit to have her own shop and support the rest of her children as they finish their studying and get good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She sells fresh fish in the Baray market and makes around $2 in profits each day. 

She has a life partner in her husband who works on their farm. When he has time to spare from his farming business, he goes fishing in the local lake.

Nou is asking for a loan of $800 to rent a machine to plow her existing farmland, and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

Nou has four children: two are employed as sewing workers in a factory, and two are married and live in their own houses.

loans.use: to rent a machine to plow her farmland, and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn (in the photo) is 33 years old, and her husband, Sam Oeun, is 31 years old. They live along National Road 2, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school. 

Sophorn is a garment-factory worker, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk because a tuk tuk could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi.

Hence Sophorn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is the leader of this group. She is 30 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is raising a newborn daughter. In order to earn money to cover their daily needs, the family breeds livestock animals and then resells them at a higher price after they have been fattened. Nazgul also sells dairy products to make additional money. The family’s monthly income is 3,300 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). With money received from the loan, Nazgul wants to purchase more sheep for breeding. In the future, with money gained from reselling livestock, Nazgul wishes to purchase a vehicle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Soda

texts.en:
Soda is 25 years old and married. They have one child who is 4 years old. She raises animals. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for four years. Together they can get an income of $4.5 per day, but almost 80% of that is from her husband's work. 

Every month, she has to spend $55 on food and $10 on electricity. 

The motorcycle that her husband is using right now is old and is not working properly, so she would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a new motorcycle for her husband. 

She wants to buy a small shop in Kompong Chhnag market when she can save some of money and also wants to send her child to study until he can get a good job in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's career.

loans.name: Baktabu's Group

texts.en:
Baktabu is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is raising two sons. The first son is in school, and the second is not yet, since he is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to cover their daily needs, the family breeds livestock and resells it at a higher price after the animals have been fattened. Baktabu also sells milk and eggs to contribute additional money to the family budget. With money received from the loan, Baktabu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. She dreams of purchasing a big house for the family in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Boreth

texts.en:
Boreth, 60 years old, is a food seller. She is a single mother with four children, 25, 17, 16 and 15 years old. Two of her children are working and two are still studying. 

The income of this family is $10 a day. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy beer to sell with the food she is selling every day. She plans to open a beer shop and sell the food or groceries together to make more profit to support her family and be able to send her children to study until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy beer to sell with the food she already sells.

loans.name: Rie

texts.en:
Rie, 30 years old, is a tailor. She is married to a state teacher and they have two children, 5 and 2 years old. They both get an income of only $5 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $70 on food and $10 on electricity. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics to make those into clothes that she can sell to get some profit. She wants to open a tailoring shop in the future if her career gets successful and she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Shura's Group

texts.en:
Shura is the leader of this group. She is 60 years old and, unfortunately, a widow. She has raised two daughters and three sons. All the children are married and employed. In order to earn money to cover their personal needs, Shura sells 9–10 liters of milk every day. She also owns a piece of land, where she cultivates potatoes. She applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase fertilizers for growing potatoes and wheat. Part of the loan will be used to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest. In the future, Shura plans to start building a house for her sons in Bishkek. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Luan's Group

texts.en:
Luan was born in 1965. She lives in Dai Bi village and has three children. The first daughter was married, the two younger children are going to school. Her husband is a worker in Da Hoi. Miss Luan is a farmer. She not only grows rice, but also raises pigs and poultry. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. 

Miss Luan wants to have a better life, so she always tries to work. She has participated in SEDA since 2005. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy pigs.

About other borrowers in her group:

Than is 49 years old. She has a store. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store.

Men is 60 years old. She sells eggs in the market. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Edgar

texts.ru:
Эдгару 29 лет, он живет в г.Севан с родителями и с братом. Образование получил высшее, окончив факультет управления энергетикой Ереванского политехнического института. По специальности никогда не работал. 
Начиная с 2009 года Эдгар занимается производством лаваша (армянкого хлеба), в пекарне, которую он основал во дворе своего дома. Продукция Эдгара продается во многих продовольственный магазинах г.Севан и лаваш его производства пользуется большой популярностью у жителей города. 
Родители и брат Эдгара помогауют ему в бизнесе и, благодаря этому, они содержат свою семью и платят за образования брата Эдгара. Мать Эдгара работает, по совместительству, учительницей в средней школе. 
Эдгару необходим кредит в 1.000.000 драм для приобретения небольшого автомобиля для скорейшей доставки своей продукции в магазины города.
texts.en:
Edgar is 29 years old. He lives in the town of Sevan with his parents and brother. He has higher education and graduated from polytechnic institute of Yerevan majoring in energy management.

Starting in 2009 Edgar has been in the business of production of lavash (Armenian flat bread) in a bakery which he started in the front yard of his house. Edgar's production is sold in many grocery stores of Sevan and his lavash is very popular among the town's residents.

Edgar's parents and brother help him in this business and thanks to their help they are able to support the family and pay for the education of Edgar's brother. Edgar's mother also works as a teacher in a secondary school. Edgar needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to buy a mini truck for fast delivery of his product to the stores in town.

loans.use: to buy a mini truck for his business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with 3 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Helen sells a variety of products in her general store. She has had this business for 30 years. Each month she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase a variety of products such as toothpaste, shampoo and soap- any products needed in the household.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as toothpaste, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 44-year-old housewife, married to Muhsin who has retired from working at Jordan University. They have four children to raise. 

After her husband's retirement, and because she wanted to devote herself to her kids, Najah helped her husband to open a store for selling cosmetics and cleaning products in their neighborhood by taking their first loan.

Now, since their business is successfully running, Najah is applying for another loan to buy more cosmetic products for their humble store. Because Najah is a conservative person, she suggested that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products for their humble store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 57 years old and married with 5 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. Violeta has been running a general store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns an income from tailoring and room rentals. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell and raw materials for her room rentals business. She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Violeta aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell and raw materials for her room rentals business

loans.name: Cherl

texts.en: Cherl is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  They live in the Philippines. Cherl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. Cherl has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Cherl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purcase canned goods, snacks, and biscuits

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 52 years old and lives in Bagacay, Sibutad Zamoboanga del Norte, She is married with one child.

To earn a living, Anecita has a grocery store where she sells a variety of food products. She earns about 4,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Anecita has a requested a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her 2 children. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Violeta requested an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings. Violeta is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Emalinda

texts.en: Emalinda  is 46 years old, single, and has one child.  They live in the Philippines. Emalinda  has a beauty shop that provides hair dying, pedicures, and manicures. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy materials needed for pedicures, manicures, and hair dying. Emalinda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emalinda  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for pedicures, manicures, and hair dying

loans.name: Cresanta

texts.en:
Cresanta is 40 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Cresanta started a mini-grocery store 9 years ago, and continues the business today. She sells assorted products in the area. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from her business. 

Not contented, Cresanta plans to add an extension to her store, so she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Cresanta has been member of GDMPC more than 3 years. In the future, she dreams of having a big grocery store in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 48 years old and married. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Leonora's husband is a fisherman.

Leonora buys and sells "tuba" (coconut wine). She started this business a year ago. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items like noodles and canned goods. She earns about 4000 PHP per month from her businesses.

Leonora has requested a loan and plans to use it for her coconut wine business. She will buy more "tuba" to sell and more "tuba" containers.

loans.use: to buy more "tuba" (coconut wine) to sell and containers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  is 23 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a business selling snacks. She earns about Php 1000 each month doing this type of work. Elizabeth has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 67 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emma has been in business for 41 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and selling bananas. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to  grow and expand her business to secure her future.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products such as soap, shampoo and basic kitchen ingredients to the people in her community. Helen has had this business for five years.
Helen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional retail items such as canned goods and soft drinks to increase her income. Each month, Helen earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. In the future, Helen hopes to attract more customers to her business and earn more profit to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail items such as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Johnry

texts.en: Johnry is 23 years old and married.  They live in the Philippines. Johnry has a motorcycle, or habal-habal, that provides transportation services to commuters. He has had this business for two years. He is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Johnry is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Johnry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase items to sell such as sardines, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Irene has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from Carinderia (a local eatery). She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ferdos

texts.en: Ferdos is a 43-year-old hardworking mother. After her husband passed away she was left with seven children under the age of eighteen to raise. In order to support her family she needed to find a job that would not keep her away from her children. So, three years ago, she bought a sewing machine and knitting tools, and started sewing clothes and cover sheets, and knitting scarves and gorgeous girls' dresses. Now Ferdos is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine that will help her work more quickly and increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old and married with three children.  With one child in school, Jane works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jane has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

In the future Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
46-year-old Gemma is an entrepreneur from Surallah, South Cotabato. She earns a living by growing vegetables and raising pigs and chickens. Gemma sells her harvest and raised pigs at her town's local market. She sells chicken eggs as well.

Gemma's loan will be used to buy feed, vitamins and fertilizers. She hopes to have a productive business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and fertilizers.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is a hard-working entrepreneur who is a manufacturer and dealer in herbal medicines in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her herbal medicine business.

Azucena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming sugar cane and rice.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of purchasing equipment for medicine manufacturing in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is married with two children. Norlyn is 39 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, she has a general store that sells a variety of products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and products that are needed in the household and has had this business for four years. She requested a loan to purchase more products for her general store.

Norlyn has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 60 years old and married with five children. Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Estelita has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Estelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as spices, groceries, etc. Lucia has borrowed from and repaid 10 loans to NWTF before this one. She has been running the sari-sari store for many years and also earns extra income from a piggery. Lucia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 36 years old, married, and has nine children. Six of them are boys and three are girls. Nazeeran couldn't provide an education to all of her children due to financial constraints. 

Her eldest son left his education after the ninth grade and started his business. He prepares and fits sofa covers to order. He is very skillful and provides good quality services to his clients. 

Nazeeran supports her family by doing tailoring. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to earn income. Her eldest daughter also helps her in completing the orders on time. 

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son's business. With the loan, he will purchase sofa covers and thread to expand his business. He has been operating this business for the past 13 years and Nazeeran is very hopeful that his business will be expanded further after the loan investment. 

She wants to marry her elder daughter who is 23 years old and is hopeful that she will be able to purchase a dowry with the help of her son's improved business.

loans.use: To buy sofa covers and thread

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married and has four children.  She works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice. Gemma is requesting a loan for 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a 45-year-old married mother of one child, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a sari-sari store for five years in the Philippines and also earns an income from selling Avon products. Lilia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF and has now requested a PHP 10000 loan to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lilia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 53 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products such as shampoo, soaps and detergents to the people in her community. Each month, Gregoria earns about 5,000 PHP from her business.

Gregoria is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional retail items such as canned goods, soft drinks and instant noodles to sell. In the future, Gregoria hopes to start a hog-raising business to generate more earnings and save funds for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her shop.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and married with four children. She has been raising pigs for two years and also earns income from the buying and selling of livestock.

Victoria is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with two children aged sixteen and fourteen.

Helen earns a living farming corn and raising ducks. She tills her land and prepares it well for her crops. Helen sells her harvest at her town's market. She also sells duck eggs.

Helen's loan will be used to buy fertilizer, duck feed and vitamins. She hopes this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, duck feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Gemma has a restaurant and a business selling grocery products. She earns about 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Gemma has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for her restaurant business and purchase products for her mini-grocery store.

Gemma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant and purchase products for her mini-grocery store

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Pilar has been raising livestock  for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Pilar is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional animals to raise, as well as feed and vitamins.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals, feed and vitamins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1984. She is married with two children. They are still young.  Her husband is a carpenter. Miss Khanh has a beverage store where she sells fruit, coffee, etc. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. 

Khanh has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is 47 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the past 11 years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD in order to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has a good credit history with KADET. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

Risa wants to prosper in farming and provide basic needs to the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 29 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in the Philippines. Geraldine has a shop that sells snacks especially polvoron, a common dessert similar to shortbread. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like flour, milk powder, and candy cellophane. Geraldine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Geraldine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, milk powder, and candy cellophane.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with 4 children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 15 years, Bakari has operated a bicycle spare parts shop, selling to his local community neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation of charcoal from the market place to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming a big supplier of spare parts in the future.

With the 60,000 KES, he wants to purchase bicycles and motorcycle spare parts for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bicycles and motorcycle spare parts for sale

loans.name: Jenedina

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Jenedina lives with her family in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Jenedina is a farmer. She grows rice crops and vegetables. She also retails gasoline. Jenedina plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and more gasoline to sell. 

She hopes to have a stable business and be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 54, married, and has three children who are in school. 

Andrea has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Andrea requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

In the future, Andrea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sous

texts.en:
Mr. Sous, age 46, is a domestic rice cultivator in the Baray district. He is married and the father of four, three of whom are single and work in a variety of jobs, while the last is a student who studies in a public school. 

Mr. Sous uses his farm to grow different kinds of crops and a few vegetables. His wife works alongside him in the field. Mr. Sous will be using his Kiva loA. to buy piglets and cows to raise. He will sell them when they are big enough.

loans.use: to buy piglets and cows to raise and sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. Michelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits, and beverages. She has had this business for three years and has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory. Michelle is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ester works hard to support her family. 

She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food and personal products. Ester is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. 

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 39 years old and married. Ammie has three school-aged children. Ammie's spouse works as a tricycle driver and operator. 

Ammie and her husband have been in the business of motorcycle transport for almost 15 years. Each month, Ammie earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She plans to use this loan to pay for franchise renewal and plans to invest in her rice vending business to boost her profits. 

Ammie has been a client of ASKI for three years. In the future, Ammie would like to educate all her children in order for them to have a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and to invest in her rice vending business.
