loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with three children. Ernesto provides motorela or habal-habal transportation services. He has had this business for three years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorbike. Ernesto has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ernesto hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 35 years, he has operated a clothes-selling business, selling in a shop and from door to door to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation from rural areas to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to purchase bundles of khangas (brightly colored patterned cloth, commonly worn as a wrap or scarf)  and baby clothes for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of khangas and baby clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a housewife and a very good administrator. She manages her household expenses very well and does her household tasks by staying at home. 

She is also a very caring mother to five sons. Three of them are drivers and drive a rickshaw while the others stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Sughran couldn't educate them and they had to start work at an early age. 

Her husband is also a rickshaw driver. He is a good driver and also provides pick-up and drop-off services to school children. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy a new body for his rickshaw and get some repair work done. This will help him save his business assets and allow him to provide better transport services to his passengers. 

He has been operating this business for the past 15 years, and Sughran is very hopeful that her husband's business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To repair and buy a new body for a rickshaw

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling nipa (palms) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Gleceria earns additional income from fish vending and fishing.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to sell for her business. Gleceria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with two children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Lydia raises and breeds livestock, specifically goats and cows. She has been doing this just this year. She has requested a loan to purchase a cow for breeding.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is married and has a business buying and selling nipa (palms) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now. Isabelita works hard to support her family.

She has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Isabelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en: Eliseo, single, is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He provides motorela or habal-habal transportation services. He has had this business for four years. He is requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorbike. Eliseo has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eliseo hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorbike

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 32 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell In her sari-sari store, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jenalyn has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming tobacco.

Jenalyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 56 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell (like milk, groceries, etc.) in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading and farming nipa (palm, used for various purposes, such as roofing thatch).

Lorna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Mrs. Sek is a 59-year-old woman, married to Mr. Chhoun; both of them work on their farm. They can use their farmland to produce crops at least twice a year according to the season (the rainy season or the dry season). The couple has  spent much time working in the field and is making an average of $5 per day to cover expenses such as food, education, utilities, and so on. 

They have four children, one of whom is employed in the sewing department of a factory. 

Mrs. Sek will be using part of her loan for her husband to buy a motor-trailer to provide transport for people who need to go to the market or elsewhere. With the remaining funds she will purchase several items for resale.

loans.use: to buy a motor-trailer and to purchase several items for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Mercy has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Mercy is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is married. She has 2 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte.

Roxan sells shampoo, toothpaste, soap and anything that is needed for the household to earn a living. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns PHP 4,000 by doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 to purchased more products for her business.

Roxan has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchased more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Nilda has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widow with 3 children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. 

For the past 20 years, Mwanasha has operated a business selling doughnuts at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanasha dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

Mwanasha plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to start another business by purchasing bales of mitumba (secondhand clothes) for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of mitumba (secondhand clothes) for sale.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 35 years old and married, with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. Suzette has been running a general store in the Philippines for 8 years. She also earns an income from pig fattening, buying and selling frozen products and farming rice.

Suzette has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. Suzette hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a 32-year-old married man, with one infant, living in the Philippines. His spouse devotes herself full time to nursing their child. Arnold has been in the motorcycle transport business for five years. He earns approximately PHP 4,000 monthly.

Arnold is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase new tires and side mirrors for his motorcycle to ensure the safety of his passengers and to generate more income. In the future, Arnold would like to earn additional money to meet his family's daily consumption and to be able to lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and side mirrors for his motorcycle

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1956. She lives in Dai Bi village with her husband. She has 4 children who have been married.  Her husband sells things which are made of paper to burn for the dead such as paper money, paper houses, and paper umbrellas. 

Miss Hoa has a restaurant in the market where she sells rice, noodle, cobbler, etc. She has had this job for 10 years. Her family has a monthly income of about 7.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). Hoa likes paying loans per week. So, she has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. During the last cycle she borrowed 6.322.000 VND and repaid this loan. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.938.000 VND to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Alicia has been in this business for 4 years.

Alicia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as rice and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.  In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Penaflor

texts.en:
Penaflor is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Penaflor runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising chickens. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell.

Penaflor has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could buy her own space in a market.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Melinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory. Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge is 32 years old, married man and has two young children. His wife works as a teacher and he has worked as a farmer for the last 10 years, growing rice and vegetables. He also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store to supplement his family's income. He is applying for this loan to buy 13 bags of fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Jorge hopes to become a successful independent businessman.

loans.use: to buy 13 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is 33 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 40,000 from NWTF to buy a new case and motor for her boat, and more netting to catch fish and crabs. She has been in this business for 13 years and would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a fishing business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 36 years old, married and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad, ZDN with her husband and two children. She runs a business selling soap, toothpaste and other items people need in their homes. She earns about PHP 5,200 a month and is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is married and works hard to support her five children. She runs a tailoring business in the Philippines and is applying for a loan for PHP 1,800 from NWTF to buy a new stove that will make more efficient use of the firewood she uses for her cooking. The new stove will also help the environment and reduce health hazards and other risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a new stove.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, and beverages. Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Tsetsegmaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Both of her daughters attend secondary school while she earns a living running a grocery. She has been in this business for nine years and her shop has grown in recent years. Tsetsegmaa spends most of her time selling items while her husband makes a living delivering food in a microbus. Tsetsegmaa started her store with a small investment and has been careful to continually expand and enhance her business. Local customers are satisfied with the variety of food she sells, and there are no other stores nearby. Earlier this year, she rented new space in a nearby shopping center and began selling clothing there. She is applying for this loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Maulidi

texts.en:
Maulidi is a married woman with four children, one of whom still attends school, while the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During hot dry season the availability of fish for sale is lower and demand is higher while during rainy season the availability of fish for sale is higher and demand is lower. Maulidi dreams of expanding and purchasing a freezer to store fish for sale in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fishing nets and hooks. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
23-year-old Kris is a married man who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. At a young age, Kris learned farming from his parents. Now he tills his own land to earn a living for himself and his wife. Kris primarily grows corn. He sells his harvest at his town market. Kris also raises pigs in his backyard.

Kris will use his loan to purchase fertilizers, feed and vitamins. He hopes to earn better and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Shovkhat

texts.ru:
Shovkhat was born in 1955. She is married and has 6 children. Her daughter helps mother in her work and Shovkhat teachs her a good sew. Shovkhat, her husband and children live in Baku region. 
Now Shovkhat needs 2000 ANZ to buy a new sewing machine for improving her business. Her old sewing machine machine was spoiled. She started this business 11 years ago. She learned sewing business from her mother.
texts.en:
Shovkhat was born in 1955. She is married and has six children. Her daughter helps mother with her business and Shovkhat teaches her how to sew well.  Shovkhat, her husband and children live in the Baku region. She started this business eleven years ago. She learned about sewing business from her mother.

At this time Shovkhat needs 2000 ANZ to buy a new sewing machine to improve her business. Her old sewing machine has worn out.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products to sell at her store.
